The second version of ''[[Minecraft 4k]]'' was released on December 4, 2009. It changed controls, added widescreen support, more blocks, and the ability to place and destroy blocks.

== Additions ==
=== Blocks ===
'''[[File:Grass Block 4K2.png|32px]] [[Minecraft 4k/Grass Block|Grass Block]]'''

'''[[File:Dirt 2 4K2.png|32px]] [[Minecraft 4k/Dirt|Dirt]]'''
* Available in 10 variants.

'''[[File:Stone 4K2.png|32px]] [[Minecraft 4k/Stone|Stone]]'''

'''[[File:Bricks 4K2.png|32px]] [[Minecraft 4k/Bricks|Bricks]]'''

'''[[File:Log 4K2.png|32px]] [[Minecraft 4k/Log|Log]]'''

'''[[File:Leaves 4K2.png|32px]] [[Minecraft 4k/Leaves|Leaves]]'''

=== World generation ===
* An invisible wall now surrounds the world, preventing the [[player]] from escaping.

=== Gameplay ===
* Widescreen
'''[[Controls]]'''
* Placing and destroying [[block]]s.
** Left-clicking and middle-clicking places a block. Right-clicking destroys a block.

== Changes ==
=== Gameplay ===
'''[[Controls]]'''
* The camera now only moves when the player moves the cursor a considerably large distance away from the center of the game's {{w|viewport}}.

=== General ===
* Increased the game's resolution from 640×480 to 854×480.

== Removals ==
=== Blocks ===
'''[[File:XOR 4K1.png|32px]] [[XOR Block]]'''
* Replaced by the grass block.
